NEW DELHI: The 2024 edition of the Indian Premier League concluded on a high note with Kolkata Knight Riders securing their third title, accompanied by a substantial prize money of INR 20 crore. Their triumph over Sunrisers Hyderabad at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai not only brought them the prestigious trophy but also a significant financial reward.The total prize pool for IPL 2024 was INR 46.5 crore, distributed among the winners, runners-up, and other top-performing teams and individuals.SRH, who finished as runners-up, were awarded INR 13 crore for their commendable performance throughout the tournament.In addition to the top two teams, Rajasthan Royals and Royal Challengers Bengaluru also received notable prize money for their achievements. NEW DELHI: The ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024 is set to ignite excitement in the USA and the Caribbean. With 20 teams competing across three venues in the USA and six in the Caribbean, cricket fans can expect intense action.In the USA leg, ten teams will kickstart the tournament with 16 matches in Lauderhill, Dallas, and New York. A highlight is the India vs. Pakistan clash on June 9 in Long Island, New York. The tournament spans 29 days, promising thrilling cricket.The Caribbean leg features 41 matches across six islands, leading to the grand finale in Barbados on June 29. The journey begins on June 1, with USA facing Canada and the West Indies taking on Papua New Guinea the next day, setting the stage for an exhilarating tournament.The tournament features four groups, each with five teams. The top two teams from each group progress to the Super Eight stage, leading to the knockout semi-finals and the ultimate final showdown.The much-anticipated India squad for the T20 World Cup was unveiled in Ahmedabad by the BCCI following a meeting between secretary Jay Shah and chief selector Ajit Agarkar. Rohit Sharma will lead the 15-member squad, which includes Rishabh Pant as the primary wicket-keeper batsman, alongside Sanju Samson. Hardik Pandya has been named the vice-captain.Apart from vice-captain Hardik, the squad features allrounders Ravindra Jadeja and Shivam Dube. The team also includes three spinners in addition to Jadeja: Kuldeep Yadav, Axar Patel, and leg spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who returns to the squad after a hiatus. Chahal's last T20I for India was against the West Indies in August 2023, while Samson and Dube last played in January against Afghanistan.In a surprising move, Rinku Singh has been included as a reserve, alongside opening batsman Shubman Gill, left-arm pacer Khaleel Ahmed, and fast bowler Avesh Khan.The squad's three specialist fast bowlers are Arshdeep Singh, Jasprit Bumrah, and Mohammed Siraj.The T20 World Cup will be held at multiple venues, with the group stage divided into four groups. India is placed in Group A with co-hosts USA and Canada, along with Ireland and Pakistan. It's the perfect opportunity for India to establish their dominance from the start.After facing Ireland, India's attention turns to the eagerly awaited showdown with arch-rivals Pakistan on June 9th at Nassau County. The thrill doesn't end there as they take on USA on June 12th and Canada on June 15th. The top two teams from each group advance to the Super 8s, where they'll meet the best from other groups.The Super 8s stage will commence on June 19th, with the semi-finals scheduled for June 26th and 27th. The final is set to take place on June 29th in Bridgetown, Barbados.With a well-balanced squad and a clear path forward, the Indian team is ready to take on the challenge and bring home the T20 World Cup trophy.

Article Title: Shah Rukh Khan: 'Tearful hugs and happy smiles': Emotional Shah Rukh Khan, Suhana and family celebrate KKR's third IPL title triumph - Watch
Article Text:
Shah Rukh Khan celebrates KKR's IPL win; kisses Gauri, Gautam Gambhir, wins fans with signature pose

NEW DELHI: Kolkata Knight Riders co-owner Shah Rukh Khan , along with his entire family, was present at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai on Sunday to witness KKR ’s triumphant victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad in the IPL 2024 final.Despite being released from the hospital a few days earlier in Ahmedabad due to a heatstroke, Shah Rukh remained a constant pillar of support for his team, accompanied by his daughter Suhana , who attended nearly all the matches this season.The victory marked KKR's third IPL title, achieved through a dominating eight-wicket win.The celebrations began early in the KKR camp, as SRH's lackluster batting performance made a KKR victory seem almost certain. When the final moment of triumph arrived, the KKR camp erupted in joy.Shah Rukh and his family, who have been steadfast supporters throughout the campaign, were visibly emotional. Suhana, who had traveled to every venue to cheer for KKR, hugged her father as Aryan and AbRam joined in thefamily celebration .Shah Rukh Khan's presence at the stadium, despite his recent health scare, underscored his dedication and love for the team. The Bollywood superstar has been an enduring figure of support for KKR, often seen rallying behind the team during tough times. This season was no exception, with Shah Rukh visiting the dressing room to motivate the players even after losses.This title win holds special significance as it marks KKR's return to glory, having previously won the IPL in 2012 and 2014 under the leadership of Gautam Gambhir , who rejoined the franchise this season as a mentor. Gambhir's return brought a sense of nostalgia and renewed determination to the team, which translated into their successful campaign.The victory at Chepauk, the same ground where KKR won their first title in 2012, added to the emotional resonance of the triumph. The win was a testament to the team's resilience, strategic brilliance, and the unwavering support from their iconic co-owner, Shah Rukh Khan, and his family.
Article Summary: Kolkata Knight Riders co-owner Shah Rukh Khan was present at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai to witness KKR ’s triumphant victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad in the IPL 2024 final. The victory marked KKR's third IPL title, achieved through a dominating eight-wicket win. The Bollywood superstar has been an enduring figure of support for KKR, often seen rallying behind the team.

Article Title: Great gesture, says Taposh Chatterjee on BCCI's Rs 25 lakh reward for ground staff
Article Text: JAIPUR: Acknowledging the effort behind providing ‘brilliant pitches in difficult weather conditions’, the BCCI secretary Jay Shah on Monday announced that curators and groundsmen at the 10 regular Indian Premier League ( IPL ) venues will be rewarded with Rs 25 lakh each.“As a token of our appreciation, the groundsmen and curators at the 10 regular IPL venues will receive INR 25 lakhs each, and the same at the 3 additional venues will get INR 10 lakhs each. Thank you for your dedication and hard work!” Shah posted on X.The BCCI elite panel curator Taposh Chatterjee called it a ‘great gesture’. “I would like to congratulate the entire fraternity and express my gratitude to the BCCI secretary and all officials for showing a great gesture. It is for the second time that they have recognised the unsung heroes who work behind the curtains. It will be a great motivating factor for the ground staff who work diligently from morning to evening,” Chatterjee said.He oversaw the preparation of the wickets at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium, the home ground of the Rajasthan Royals. The franchise won four out of five matches here this season.The curator based in Jaipur added that the reward, which is an acknowledgement of the hard work done by the groundsmen, will provide a great boost as there will be more enthusiasm when they will get down to work for the IPL in the next season. “The money will of course help the ground staff in many ways,” he said.The 10 regular venues for the IPL are Mumbai, Delhi, Chennai, Kolkata, Jaipur, Chandigarh, Hyderabad, Bengaluru, Lucknow and Ahmedabad.“Before this, it was in 2022 that the ground staff was rewarded. But this time it includes all the 10 IPL centres,” stated Chatterjee.The league matches of the 2022 season were held in Maharashtra while the playoffs were hosted by Kolkata and Ahmedabad.
Article Summary: The BCCI secretary Jay Shah on Monday announced that curators and groundsmen at the 10 regular Indian Premier League ( IPL ) venues will be rewarded with Rs 25 lakh each. The 10 regular venues for the IPL are Mumbai, Delhi, Chennai, Kolkata, Jaipur, Chandigarh, Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Lucknow.

Article Title: 'Now no one will say that they are tired': Wasim Akram calls the absence of India players in IPL final a 'blessing in disguise'
Article Text:
Top Picks For You T20 World Cup: Yuzvendra Chahal, Avesh Khan depart for US

NEW DELHI: The Indian Premier League 2024 concluded with the Kolkata Knight Riders claiming their third title by defeating Sunrisers Hyderabad in Chennai on Sunday. The absence of Team India players in the final has been highlighted by Pakistan legend Wasim Akram , who described it as a "blessing in disguise" for Indian cricket ahead of the T20 World Cup .Speaking to Sportskeeda, Akram explained that the lack of Indian players in the IPL final means they can focus entirely on their preparations for the World Cup without the added fatigue of a long tournament."Well, now at least none of them will have to say that they are tired. They were thinking ahead, what is the point of reaching the final, India is more important, we will play for the country. But it could be a blessing in disguise for India," Akram said.Akram, who was concerned about player fatigue due to the rigorous IPL schedule, noted that the Indian contingent would benefit from the extra rest and preparation time."We discussed in the previous show that I was worried that they might be tired, and they will be tired, no doubt. Even America is not their road. I think Pakistan's first match is in Dallas if I remember. Now they will go and play there, one or two practice matches. It will be okay, I suppose. It is T20, the boys will recover, nowadays fitness levels are very high," he added.The Indian squad has already arrived in New York to gear up for the T20 World Cup. They will play a warm-up match against Bangladesh on June 1 at Nassau County, providing crucial practice time before the tournament begins. The early focus on preparation is expected to give India a better chance this time around.The T20 World Cup is set to start on June 2, with Rohit Sharma 's Team India beginning their campaign against Ireland on June 5 in New York. The absence of Indian players in the IPL final ensures they are well-rested and focused, an advantage that Akram believes could be pivotal.
Article Summary: Wasim Akram says absence of Indian players in IPL final could be a "blessing in disguise" for India ahead of T20 World Cup. The Indian squad has already arrived in New York to gear up for the tournament. Rohit Sharma's side will play a warm- up match against Bangladesh on June 1 at Nassau County.

Article Title: Virat Kohli: 'He loves proving people wrong': Dinesh Karthik on Virat Kohli's stellar IPL season
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Virat Kohli , the former Royal Challengers Bengaluru skipper, delivered a masterclass in the 2024 Indian Premier League season, securing the Orange Cap and silencing critics just before the T20 World Cup . Despite facing criticism for his strike rate, Kohli emerged as the top run-scorer in the tournament, leading RCB to the playoffs.Kohli's performances were a timely reminder of his T20 prowess.He scored 741 runs in 15 innings, averaging 61.75 with a strike rate of 154.69, including one century and five fifties. This remarkable season marked the second time Kohli has claimed the Orange Cap, the first being in 2016 when he set a record with 973 runs.Throughout the league phase, Kohli faced scrutiny over his strike rate, prompting him to address the criticism head-on after a stellar knock against Gujarat Titans.Former New Zealand pacer Simon Doull advised Kohli to disregard the 'rubbish' criticism, while batting legend Sunil Gavaskar criticized broadcasters for repeatedly airing Kohli's on-air rant against pundits.RCB icon Dinesh Karthik , speaking on Cricbuzz, credited Doull for motivating Kohli."I can write a book on how he was this year. He started okay but thanks to people like Simon (Doull) and a few others, they just really spurred him on. And you don't want to see that side of Virat Kohli. I think he thrives on that. He is someone who inadvertently wants to hold on to certain things to do well," Karthik said.Kohli's fierce determination and ability to prove his detractors wrong have been central to his success."He loves proving people wrong, and even though he might not come out and say it, it really fuels his passion and he's like a molten lava coming out. He's fiery and you don't want to be anywhere close to it because you're going to get burnt for sure because he's done this time and time again," Karthik added.Kohli’s remarkable form and ability to perform under pressure make him a key player for India as they aim for World Cup glory.
Article Summary: Kohli scored 741 runs in 15 innings, averaging 61.75 with a strike rate of 154.69. RCB icon Dinesh Karthik credited Simon Doull for motivating Kohli. Kohli's fierce determination and ability to prove his detractors wrong have been central to his success.

NEW DELHI: Former India cricketer Ambati Rayudu has once again courted controversy following his comments on Virat Kohli and Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) after the IPL 2024 final.Despite Kohli's stellar performance, Rayudu pointed out that the consistency of the star batter might actually burden the team, even as he emerged as the highest run-scorer in the competition.During an analysis on Star Sports, Rayudu, along with Kevin Pietersen and Mayanti Langer, discussed the impact of having a player of Kohli's caliber on a team like RCB."When you have a stalwart and a legend like Virat Kohli, who has set really high standards, it's very hard for the youngsters to be in a side like that and try and match his standard because he always wants the team to be performing at his level.""No, it should be good for youngsters…""But sometimes the burden of really trying to be Virat Kohli in a sport where you know nobody is going to be like him.""But didn't Patidar step up to the plate?""Patidar can only be a Patidar but not a Virat Kohli, and I think RCB, as a management, understands that you cannot have 11 Virat Kohli in the team. You need to have 1 Virat Kohli with 10 others being themselves, having their own identities and strengths and weaknesses. And you need to use them well in terms of resources. You can't expect somebody to win the game in the first season. You need to give him that leeway and time to grow into a match-winner. So I think the management has its task out, and even Virat Kohli needs to ease his standards a bit when it comes to youngsters, nurturing them, and letting them grow."Earlier, in his congratulatory message to the Shreyas Iyer-led KKR, Rayudu subtly criticized RCB, emphasizing that individual accolades like the Orange Cap do not guarantee IPL titles, but rather it is the collective contributions from the entire team that lead to success."Congratulations to the KKR team for really standing up for stalwarts like Narine, Russell, and Starc, and also contributing their share in the team's win. That’s how a team wins the IPL. We have seen this over the years. It's not the Orange Cap that wins you the IPL but it is the contributions like 300 runs each (from many players)," Rayudu remarked.Kohli had an outstanding individual season, winning the Orange Cap with 741 runs in 15 innings, including one hundred and five fifties, at an average of 61.75 and a strike rate of over 154. Despite his impressive performance, RCB once again fell short of the title.This isn't the first time Rayudu has criticized RCB. Following their exit from IPL 2024 after a loss to Rajasthan Royals in the Eliminator, Rayudu took to X to express his thoughts. He pointed out the shortcomings in RCB's management and leadership, suggesting that prioritizing individual milestones over team interests has hindered their success."My heart truly goes out to all the RCB supporters who have passionately supported the team over the years. If only the management and the leaders had the team's interests ahead of individual milestones, RCB would have won multiple titles. Just remember how many fantastic players have been let go of. Force your management to bring players who will put team interests first. A great new chapter can start from the mega auction," Rayudu had written.Rayudu's remarks have sparked a significant debate in the cricketing community, highlighting the ongoing struggles of RCB to convert individual brilliance into team success.
Article Summary: Former India cricketer Ambati Rayudu has courted controversy following his comments on Virat Kohli and Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) He pointed out that the consistency of the star batter might actually burden the team. Kohli had an outstanding individual season, winning the Orange Cap with 741 runs in 15 innings.

Article Title: Gautam Gambhir: 'No rocket science': Former cricketers explain how Gautam Gambhir led KKR to the third IPL title in 2024
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Kolkata Knight Riders clinched their third Indian Premier League title in 2024 under the mentorship of Gautam Gambhir , who returned to the franchise this season.Gambhir, who previously led KKR to titles in 2012 and 2014 as captain, has been widely praised for his strategic influence and leadership.Former Sunrisers Hyderabad head coach Tom Moody commended Gambhir's impact on ESPNcricinfo, stating, "His ability to just get the ship in the right direction is crucial.He is very clear in what he believes the dressing room needed to go, the personnel that needed to be in that playing XI, and the likes of Narine being back to the top of the order again. If Gambhir was still at Lucknow this year, there was no way that Narine would have opened the batting."Moody emphasized that Gambhir's clarity and stability brought significant positive changes to KKR, addressing the confusion and inconsistency that had plagued the team in previous seasons."A lot of things have just worked perfectly for KKR this year, in a positive way. I think Gambhir should be given a huge amount of credit for his impact as a leader. He has created stability and clarity that is the most important thing," Moody added.Robin Uthappa , a former teammate of Gambhir, also praised his leadership on JioCinema."One of the things that he does as a leader is defining roles. He creates a sense and a feeling of security within the group. He defines the roles very clearly to each player. Everyone feels included, and you create a support staff that takes care of everybody. Honestly, there is no rocket science to this, and a lot of successful teams have done this. We have seen Mumbai Indians and CSK do this, and KKR, when they do this right, it actually works for them," Uthappa remarked.Uthappa noted that Gambhir's absence in recent years had seen the team lose its way, but his return brought back the successful strategies from his captaincy days."Now he is doing it as a mentor, and you can see the fruits of all that work that he has put in," Uthappa added.Gambhir's return as mentor has evidently paid off, as KKR's 2024 IPL triumph underscores the importance of strong leadership and strategic clarity in achieving success. His ability to define roles, create a supportive environment, and maintain a clear direction has been instrumental in KKR's resurgence, earning him widespread acclaim within the cricketing community.
Article Summary: Kolkata Knight Riders clinched their third Indian Premier League title in 2024. Gautam Gambhir has been widely praised for his strategic influence and leadership. He previously led KKR to titles in 2012 and 2014 as captain. Former teammate Robin Uthappa also praised his leadership.

Article Title: Coach Ki Khoj: Deadline ends but BCCI, Gautam Gambhir remain mum
Article Text:
(With inputs from PTI)

NEW DELHI: The deadline for submitting application for the position of Team India head coach closed on Monday but both the Board of Control for Cricket in India ( BCCI ) and the leading candidate, Gautam Gambhir , have remained tight-lipped about the situation.Gambhir's name has gained significant traction, especially after he led the Kolkata Knight Riders to their third Indian Premier League ( IPL ) title on Sunday.Neither the BCCI nor Gambhir has made any official statements yet as it appears that the Indian cricket board may not have a wide range of high-caliber candidates to choose from at present.It is understood that no notable foreign name has applied for the post, especially after BCCI secretary Jay Shah made it clear that the Board is looking at someone who has risen through the ranks and knows the domestic structure.It could be safely said that the BCCI's primary target was VVS Laxman, the National Cricket Academy head, but the stylish Hyderabadi seems not interested in a full time position which requires him to available for 10 months a year."The deadline is fine, but the BCCI brass wouldn't mind taking some more time before reaching a decision. Right now, the team will be busy with World T20 for the better part of the month of June. After that seniors will be rested from tours of Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe where any of the NCA-based senior coaches can accompany the team. So what's the hurry," a BCCI source told PTI on conditions of anonymity.Also, KKR principal owner Shah Rukh Khan shares a deep bond with Gambhir and it is not easy to leave an IPL team which has been a part of identity for the former India opener.There's another aspect that needs to be look into seriously -- what senior India players, currently in New York, feel on whether Gambhir can indeed be Rahul Dravid's replacement.
Article Summary: The deadline for submitting application for the position of Team India head coach closed on Monday. The Board of Control for Cricket in India ( BCCI ) and the leading candidate, Gautam Gambhir, have remained tight-lipped about the situation. Gambhirs name has gained significant traction after he led the Kolkata Knight Riders to their third Indian Premier League ( IPL ) title on Sunday.

Article Title: Fourteen-time champion Rafael Nadal knocked out in French Open first round
Article Text:
(With inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Rafa Nadal experienced his earliest exit from the French Open on Monday, falling 6-3, 7-6(5), 6-3 in the first round to fourth seed Alexander Zverev. This unexpected defeat has left fans questioning whether the 14-time champion will return to the Grand Slam he has dominated for two decades.The 22-time major champion, who first claimed the Musketeers' Cup in 2005 and last lifted the trophy in 2022 before a serious hip injury disrupted his career, had hinted that this year might be his final one on the tour.Having returned to the tournament that he skipped in 2023 and refusing to confirm any farewells ahead of his opener, Nadal showed flashes of top form again on Court Philippe Chatrier but the 37-year-old ultimately went down fighting.Victory meant Zverev became only the third man to beat Nadal at Roland Garros , after Novak Djokovic and Robin Soderling, with the German banishing memories of his retirement due to an ankle injury when the duo last met in the 2022 semi-finals.Nadal was broken by in-form Rome champion Zverev in the opening game and surrendered his serve again late on to drop the first set in unfavourable conditions for him with the roof closed due to heavy rain.Faced with the prospect of only his fourth Roland Garros defeat in 116 matches, Nadal made a positive start to the next set as he leapt and pumped his fists after holding for 2-2 and broke for the first time with a delicate drop.The crowd began to sense a comeback as Nadal went ahead 4-2 with some vintage shots on both flanks but the steely Zverev hit back in the 10th game and saved two breakpoints before doubling his advantage by edging a high-octane tiebreak.Watched on by his great rival Djokovic and a host of other current players, Nadal surged to a 2-0 lead in the third set but squandered it as Zverev drew level and dealt another body blow in the seventh game.The boisterous crowd tried their best to roar Nadal on but Zverev held his nerve to clinch a famous victory that could well prove to be the springboard he needs to push for an elusive first Grand Slam title.
Article Summary: Rafa Nadal suffers his earliest exit from the French Open on Monday. The 14-time champion lost 6-3, 7-6(5), 6- 3 to fourth seed Alexander Zverev. The 22-time major champion had hinted that this year might be his final one on the tour.

Article Title: 'Everyone called him a mad man but...': Internet bows down to Gautam Gambhir for picking IPL's biggest buy ever Mitchell Starc
Article Text:
Brief scores:

NEW DELHI: When Kolkata Knight Riders mentor Gautam Gambhir bought Australian left-arm speedster Mitchell Starc for a record-shattering sum of Rs 24.75 crore in the December auction last year, fans and even pundits were absolutely stunned.And after a jittery start to the season, where Starc was taken to the cleaners in almost every league game, trolling and memes followed Gambhir and KKR alongside Starc.But as the tournament progressed the 34-year-old regained his lost rhythm and in the playoffs produced a couple of sensational performances, shutting down every critique.After flooring Sunrisers Hyderabad in Qualifier 1, Starc once again roared with a mind-boggling performance against the same opposition in the IPL Final on Sunday.And with pacer having a memorable night in the final, mentor Gambhir too was hailed by everyone for his belief in Starc.What started as a tease and fun turned into appreciation and respect as Gambhir was lauded for his choice during the IPL auction.In the final on Sunday, left-arm quick Starc returned figures of 2 for 14 while fellow quicks Andre Russell and Harshit Rana shared five wickets between them to dismiss the Sunrisers for a lowly 113 in 18.3 overs at Chennai's MA Chidambaram Stadium.It was the lowest total in an IPL final after Chennai Super Kings' previous low of 125-9 in their loss to Mumbai Indians in 2013.KKR, then hunted down the total inside 11 overs to clinch their third IPL title, beating SRH by eight wickets in Chennai.Venkatesh Iyer remained not out on 52 off 26 balls, taking his side across the finish line.Starc, Andre Russell (3/19) and Harshit Rana (2/24) were the most successful bowlers for the Knight Riders, as SRH simply failed to turn up for the big game.Opting to bat first, SRH were off to a disastrous start as they lost their top guns Abhishek Sharma and Travis Head with just six runs on the board, with the latter getting dismissed for a first-ball duck to a beautiful outswinger.Before that, Abhishek was bowled by Mitchell Starc on the fifth ball of the first over, a peach of a delivery opening up the left-hander before hitting the top of the off stump.SRH were in all sorts of trouble as Starc accounted for the wicket of Rahul Tripathi to leave them reeling at 21/3 in the fifth over, the swing doing the trick for KKR bowlers early on.First-change bowler Harshit Rana continued the good work and got rid of Nitish Reddy (13). Andre Russell dismissed Aiden Markram in his first over as SRH slipped to 62/5 in the 11th over.SRH could not recover from there.Sunrisers Hyderabad: 113 all out in 18.3 overs (Pat Cummins 24; Mitchell Starc 2/14, Andre Russell 3/19, Harshit Rana 2/24).Kolkata Knight Riders: 114 for 2 in 10.3 overs (Venkatesh Iyer 52 not out).
Article Summary: Kolkata Knight Riders beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by eight wickets in IPL final. Mitchell Starc took 2 for 14 as KKR bowled out SRH for 113 in 18.3 overs. Andre Russell and Harshit Rana shared five wickets between them.

Article Title: Gautam Gambhir meets Jay Shah after KKR's third IPL title amid speculations of India head coach role
Article Text:
Bollywood actress Juhi Chawla (2R) along with her family members pose next to Jay Shah (L) and Gautam Gambhir. (AFP Photo)

NEW DELHI: Kolkata Knight Riders mentor Gautam Gambhir was in high spirits on Sunday night at the MA Chidambaram Stadium after his team clinched their third IPL title with a convincing victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad.Gambhir, a key figure in KKR 's success, was seen celebrating with the players and obliging fans with photographs. Amidst the celebrations, he also took time to meet and greet BCCI secretary Jay Shah , sparking speculations about his potential future as India's head coach.Gambhir has emerged as the frontrunner to replace Rahul Dravid , whose tenure as India head coach ends after the 2024 T20 World Cup in June. With Dravid not reapplying for the position, the BCCI has opened the search for his successor, with the contract slated to last until the end of the 2027 ODI World Cup Several Australian cricket legends, including Ricky Ponting and Justin Langer, were initially linked to the role. However, both have denied applying, and Shah clarified that the BCCI prefers an Indian coach who is more familiar with domestic cricket. This preference places Gambhir in a favorable position for the job.On Sunday, Shah's interaction with Gambhir fueled further speculation. The BCCI secretary was seen congratulating Gambhir, taking photographs, and engaging in a lengthy conversation on the sidelines of KKR's celebrations in Chennai. This gesture was seen by many as an endorsement of Gambhir's candidacy for the head coach role.Gambhir's potential appointment as head coach is highly anticipated given his extensive experience and successful track record, both as a player and a mentor. His strategic acumen and familiarity with the current crop of Indian cricketers make him a strong candidate for the high-profile role.
Article Summary: Kolkata Knight Riders mentor Gautam Gambhir was in high spirits after his team clinched their third IPL title with a convincing victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad. He was seen celebrating with the players and obliging fans with photographs. Amidst the celebrations, he also took time to meet and greet BCCI secretary Jay Shah, sparking speculations about his potential future.

Article Title: T20 World Cup: Indian cricketers reach New York - Watch
Article Text:
(With ANI inputs)

NEW DELHI: The first group of Indian players to travel to the United States has arrived in New York to participate in the T20 World Cup 2024.The Indian cricket team, led by captain Rohit Sharma , pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah , and top-ranked T20I hitter Suryakumar Yadav , departed for the US earlier on Saturday.Using its official social media account, the Board of Control for Cricket in India ( BCCI ) posted a video showing the players traveling to the United States in preparation for the T20 World Cup.The Indian cricket players were seen getting on the team vehicle and departing the New York airport in the footage."Touchdown New York! #TeamIndia have arrived for the #T20WorldCup," BCCI wrote on X.On June 5, India will play Ireland in the T20 World Cup at the brand-new Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York. The match between India and Pakistan is scheduled for June 9.Their Group A matches will be concluded later on June 12 against the USA, the tournament co-host, and on June 15 against Canada.
Article Summary: The Indian cricket team, led by captain Rohit Sharma, departed for the US earlier on Saturday. The Board of Control for Cricket in India posted a video showing the players traveling to the United States. India will play Ireland in the T20 World Cup at the brand-new Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York.

Article Title: 'It's not the Orange Cap that wins you the IPL': Ambati Rayudu's subtle dig at Virat Kohli and Royal Challengers Bengaluru
Article Text:
Top Picks For You 'It was a rollercoaster of a ride': Virat Kohli celebrates Orange Cap despite another trophyless campaign

NEW DELHI: Kolkata Knight Riders continued their dominance in the 2024 Indian Premier League by securing their third title with an emphatic victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. The comprehensive win showcased KKR's all-round strength, with significant contributions from multiple players.Former India batter Ambati Rayudu , in his congratulatory message to the Shreyas Iyer-led side, took a subtle dig at Virat Kohli and Royal Challengers Bengaluru .Speaking on Star Sports after the match, Rayudu emphasized that individual accolades, such as the Orange Cap , do not guarantee IPL titles, but rather it is the collective contributions from the entire team that lead to success."Congratulations to the KKR team for really standing up for stalwarts like Narine, Russell, and Starc, and also contributing their share in the team's win. That’s how a team wins the IPL. We have seen this over the years. It's not the Orange Cap that wins you the IPL but it is the contributions like 300 runs each (from many players)," Rayudu remarked.Kohli had an outstanding individual season, winning the Orange Cap with 741 runs in 15 innings, including one hundred and five fifties, at an average of 61.75 and a strike rate of over 154. Despite his impressive performance, RCB once again fell short of the title.This wasn't the first time Rayudu criticized RCB. Following their exit from IPL 2024 after a loss to Rajasthan Royals in the Eliminator, Rayudu took to X to express his thoughts. He pointed out the shortcomings in RCB's management and leadership, suggesting that prioritizing individual milestones over team interests has hindered their success."My heart truly goes out to all the RCB supporters who have passionately supported the team over the years. If only the management and the leaders had the team's interests ahead of individual milestones, RCB would have won multiple titles. Just remember how many fantastic players have been let go of. Force your management to bring players who will put team interests first. A great new chapter can start from the mega auction," Rayudu had written.
Article Summary: Ambati Rayudu congratulates Kolkata Knight Riders on their third IPL title. Former India batter takes a subtle dig at Virat Kohli and Royal Challengers Bengaluru. RCB were eliminated from IPL 2024 after a loss to Rajasthan Royals in the Eliminator.

Article Title: 'The heartbeat of KKR - Shah Rukh Khan!': Shreyas Iyer's special mention after IPL 2024 triumph
Article Text:
Shah Rukh Khan celebrates KKR's IPL win; kisses Gauri, Gautam Gambhir, wins fans with signature pose

(With inputs from ANI)

NEW DELHI: On a humid night with clouds hovering over Chepauk, Kolkata Knight Riders celebrated their third IPL title, securing an emphatic eight-wicket victory over Sunrisers Hyderabad in the final. Under the astute leadership of Shreyas Iyer , KKR delivered a commanding performance that culminated in lifting the coveted trophy.In his post-match remarks, Iyer gave a special mention to the "heartbeat" of the team, co-owner Shah Rukh Khan , whose unwavering support has been a cornerstone of the franchise's spirit.The Bollywood icon has been a constant presence at KKR matches, traveling across the nation to cheer for his team. SRK 's encouragement was particularly vital, as he even visited the dressing room to uplift the team after their setbacks during the group stages.After the win, Iyer expressed his gratitude on the X, acknowledging SRK's inspirational influence. "Special mention to the heartbeat of this team @iamsrk! Thank you for all your words of inspiration and encouragement," Iyer wrote.The victory ignited jubilant celebrations in the KKR camp, contrasting sharply with the dismay in the SRH camp. Despite the defeat, KKR extended a heartfelt message of respect and admiration to their opponents."Respect for @SunRisers. One bad game doesn't define the exceptional season you've had in any way. Some unforgettable performances, and a top #TATAIPL2024 season for the men in orange," KKR shared on X.KKR's journey to the title was marked by a stellar all-round performance in the final at the MA Chidambaram Stadium in Chennai. The team’s bowlers delivered a stunning display, restricting SRH's free-scoring batting lineup to a mere 113 runs. In response, KKR chased down the target in just 10.3 overs, losing only two wickets.The triumph was particularly sweet for KKR, as they echoed their maiden title win at the same venue in 2012 under Gautam Gambhir 's leadership. This victory not only highlighted the team's consistency and dominance throughout the season but also reaffirmed their place among the IPL's elite.
Article Summary: KKR beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by eight wickets in the IPL final. Co-owner Shreyas Iyer gave a special mention to Shah Rukh Khan. Khan has been a constant presence at KKR matches, traveling across the nation to cheer for his team.

Article Title: 'Playing IPL is better preparation than playing a T20 game against Pakistan': Michael Vaughan blasts England's decision to call players back
Article Text:
IPL 2024 STANDINGS:

|

WATCH VIDEO

Former England captain Michael Vaughan has blasted the England cricket board for its decision to call players back from the Indian Premier League (IPL) for the T20I series against Pakistan.The decision by the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) has been hugely debated since England players Will Jacks (Royal Challengers Bengaluru), Phil Salt (Kolkata Knight Riders) and Jos Buttler (Rajasthan Royals) and the rest were ordered to return for international duty.Buttler, Salt and Jacks would have featured in the IPL playoffs , which Vaughan and former Australia captain Adam Gilchrist believe is a "missed opportunity". Instead they were called back in time for the first T20I against Pakistan on May 22 in Headingley, which incidentally got washed out by rain."I think England missed a trick by sending all their players home," said Vaughan on the 'Club Prairie Fire' podcast. "I think Will Jacks, Phil Salt, Jos Buttler in particular, playing in the IPL in the eliminations (playoffs), pressure, crowd, expectation, I would argue that playing here is better preparation than playing a T20 game against Pakistan."Vaughan went on to specify that he is not asking to put club cricket ahead of international duty and that his comment is based on the comparison between the pressure of playing in the IPL playoffs and in a T20 international from the point of view of preparing for the upcoming T20 World Cup in June."I am all for international cricket, but...this tournament (IPL) in particular is so exposed to pressure...players are under a huge amount of pressure from fans, owners, social media; it's massive," said the former batsman."I just felt Buttler, probably not as much but I still think he could have stayed here, but Will Jacks and Phil Salt, I think they would have been better prepared (for the T20 World Cup) staying here and playing in the IPL than going back to Headingley to play a (T20I) game."I am not disrespecting Pakistan or the England side. They haven't been playing a lot of T20 cricket together but I would say the standard here (IPL) would possibly be better...," Vaughan added.Gilchrist, who was also part of the podcast episode, concurred with Vaughan's opinion."I am sure there are a number of (England) players who could have fulfilled those obligations (for T20I series against Pakistan) in the international setup there, but the guys that were actively involved in the IPL, in the finals period (should have stayed back). I think that's a missed opportunity, spot on," said Gilchrist.The IPL final will be played between Kolkata Knight Riders and Sunrisers Hyderabad on Sunday in Chennai, which will be followed by the T20 World Cup beginning on June 2 in the US and West Indies.
Article Summary: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has blasted the England cricket board for its decision to call players back from the Indian Premier League. England players Will Jacks, Phil Salt, Jos Buttler and the rest were ordered to return for international duty. Buttler, Salt and Jacks would have featured in the IPL playoffs.

Article Title: Sunrisers Hyderabad co-owner Kavya Maran in tears after team's big loss in IPL final
Article Text: NEW DELHI: As a clinical Kolkata Knight Riders blew away Sunrisers Hyderabad in the IPL Final to lift their third title, Kavya Maran , the co-owner and CEO of the Hyderabad-based franchise, was in tears after the defeat.KKR hammered Sunrisers at the Chepauk by eight wickets in a lop-sided encounter, lifting the trophy after 10 years.After clinching the titles in 2012 and 2014, this was KKR's third IPL title.Kavya, who has been known for her love for the game and animated reactions in stands, was visibly in tears after the loss but still lauded the side for their terrific effort before the finale.Hyderabad captain Pat Cummins was left to rue his decision to bat first as his side got skittled out for 113 runs in 18.3 overs.Andre Russell was the pick of the Kolkata bowlers, claiming 3-19 in the one-sided contest at the MA Chidambaram Stadium.His team returned to chase down the target in 10.3 overs with Venkatesh Iyer leading their charge with an unbeaten 52 off 26 balls.Kolkata topped the group stage of the IPL and had beaten Hyderabad in the first playoff on Tuesday.
Article Summary: Kolkata Knight Riders beat Sunrisers Hyderabad by eight wickets in IPL Final. Co-owner and CEO of Hyderabad-based franchise Kavya Maran was in tears after the defeat. This was KKR's third IPL title after winning the tournament in 2012 and 2014.

Article Title: Shahid Afridi lauds Pakistan's bowling line-up as strongest ahead of T20 World Cup
Article Text:
Top Picks For You T20 World Cup 2024 Warm up matches: Live streaming, full schedule, match date and time

(With inputs from ANI)

NEW DELHI: Former cricketer Shahid Afridi has declared Pakistan 's bowling line-up as the strongest in the upcoming T20 World Cup , which is set to begin on June 1.Afridi's comments come as Pakistan head into the tournament as one of the favorites, following their runner-up finish in the previous edition.In a video posted by the ICC , Afridi highlighted the exceptional skill and depth of Pakistan's pace attack, which includes Shaheen Shah Afridi , Abbas Afridi, Mohammad Amir , Naseem Shah , and Haris Rauf ."I think in any cricket team in the world, nobody has such a strong bowling line-up. All our four fast bowlers have a lot of skill, and even the bowlers sitting on the bench like Abbas Afridi have a lot of skill with a good slower ball," Afridi said.He expressed confidence that these bowlers, when pitted against world-class batters, would perform exceptionally well.However, former Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chairman Ramiz Raja has expressed concerns about the team's bowling setup. Raja pointed out that while Shaheen Shah Afridi has been a standout performer, he needs to develop a more varied bowling strategy, particularly when the ball is not swinging."Shaheen Shah Afridi's bowling. Look, if the ball isn't swinging and he bowls at full length, then he gets bashed. He needs to develop length ball and change of pace, especially when he is not getting much from the pitch," Ramiz commented on his YouTube channel following Pakistan's recent 23-run defeat to England in the second T20I.Pakistan will now play the third T20I against England in Cardiff on Tuesday, a crucial match for the team to address these concerns and fine-tune their strategies ahead of the World Cup.
Article Summary: Former cricketer Shahid Afridi has declared Pakistan's bowling line-up as the strongest in the upcoming T20 World Cup. Former Pakistan Cricket Board chairman Ramiz Raja has expressed concerns about the team's bowling setup. Pakistan will now play the third T20I against England in Cardiff on Tuesday.

Article Title: Pakistan's Haris Rauf says injury lay-off a 'blessing in disguise'
Article Text:
(With inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Pakistan speedster Haris Rauf is optimistic that his three-month absence from cricket due to a shoulder dislocation might turn out to be advantageous as he prepares for the upcoming T20 World Cup .In his comeback match, the second game of Pakistan's preparatory series against England, the reigning T20 world champions, in Birmingham on Saturday, the 30-year-old pacer displayed a promising performance, claiming a couple of wickets."I was injured the last few months but if you believe in yourself, then the layoff can be a blessing in disguise," he told a pre-match press conference in Cardiff on Monday ahead of the third T20."Because you have time to recover and reassess your game-plans. I felt good coming back to cricket. When you play for your country, it makes you very proud."As for the mental and physical strain of returning from injury for a fast bowler, Rauf said: "It's hard. It's a struggle during your rehab, and it's difficult when you come back to maintain that pace and accuracy. But if you believe in yourself, it makes things easier. When I wasn't in the team and rehabbing, I had a lot of time to think about my game and work on myself."Thankfully I'm back now, and the World Cup is coming up."Rauf's return at Edgbaston could not prevent Pakistan suffering a 23-run defeat by England as they fell 1-0 behind in the four-match series with two to play following a washed-out opener.But Rauf insisted Pakistan, the 2009 T20 world champions, remained in optimistic mood ahead of their opening match at this year's global showpiece against co-hosts the United States in Dallas on June 6."When you lose a game it hurts, but as a team, we are confident," he said. "We feel we can beat any opposition on any day. We've done it in the past, too. When you make mistakes you learn and try not to repeat those mistakes. We're looking to play better in the next few games and make a comeback."The camp is relaxed. We're enjoying ourselves. We're trying to follow our game-plans and execute them well. The results haven't often been in our favour recently but if you stick to your plans they can sometimes follow."
Article Summary: Pakistan fast bowler Haris Rauf returns from shoulder injury ahead of T20 World Cup. The 30-year-old claimed a couple of wickets in his comeback match against England. Pakistan lost the second match of the four-match series by 23 runs in Birmingham.

Article Title: T20 World Cup: Yuzvendra Chahal, Avesh Khan depart for US
Article Text: NEW DELHI: India's bowlers Yuzvendra Chahal and Avesh Khan departed to join the first group of the Men in Blue squad in New York ahead of the ICC T20 World Cup , which begins on June 1.Star spinner Chahal, who had an impressive IPL 2024 season with the Rajasthan Royals, taking 18 wickets, is part of the World Cup squad. Pacer Avesh Khan will accompany the team as a reserve player.At the Mumbai airport, Avesh was seen on a video call with fellow reserve player Rinku Singh .On Sunday, the first batch of Indian players, including skipper Rohit Sharma, pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah, and top-ranked T20I batter Suryakumar Yadav, left for the United States.Among those spotted at the airport were head coach Rahul Dravid, batting coach Vikram Rathour, batter Shubman Gill, all-rounders Ravindra Jadeja and Shivam Dube, pacers Mohammed Siraj, Arshdeep Singh, and Khaleel Ahmed, along with spinners Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel.Yashasvi Jaiswal and Sanju Samson, who recently ended their IPL campaign with Rajasthan Royals after a loss to Sunrisers Hyderabad, and Kolkata Knight Riders' batter Rinku Singh, along with star batter Virat Kohli, whose Royal Challengers Bangalore team lost to RR in the eliminator, have not joined the squad yet.India will kick off their T20 World Cup campaign on June 5 against Ireland at the newly constructed Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York.The much-anticipated clash between India and Pakistan is set for June 9. Following this, India will face co-hosts USA on June 12 and Canada on June 15 to conclude their Group A matches.India aims to end their ICC trophy drought, having last won the ICC Champions Trophy in 2013. Since then, they have reached the 50-over World Cup final in 2023, semifinals in 2015 and 2019, the ICC World Test Championship final in 2021 and 2023, the T20 WC final in 2014, and semifinals in 2016 and 2022, but have not secured a major ICC trophy.India will strive to win their first T20 World Cup title since their victory in the inaugural edition in 2007 in South Africa. In the last edition held in Australia in 2022, India lost to England by 10 wickets in the semifinals.India squad: Rohit Sharma (c), Hardik Pandya (vc), Yashasvi Jaiswal, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Rishabh Pant (wk), Sanju Samson (wk), Shivam Dube, Ravindra Jadeja, Axar Patel, Kuldeep Yadav, Yuzvendra Chahal, Arshdeep Singh, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohd. SirajReserves: Shubman Gill, Rinku Singh, Khaleel Ahmed and Avesh Khan.
Article Summary: India's bowlers Yuzvendra Chahal and Avesh Khan departed to join the first group of the Men in Blue squad in New York. The ICC T20 World Cup begins on June 1. India aims to end their ICC trophy drought, having last won the ICC Champions Trophy in 2013.

Article Title: Wriddhiman Saha on way back 'home'
Article Text: KOLKATA: In a major boost to Bengal cricket before the upcoming domestic season , Wriddhiman Saha has decided to return to his home state. After 15 years of service, the wicketkeeper-batter had formally parted ways with Cricket Association of Bengal ( CAB ) on July 2, 2022 after an official questioned his commitment towards Bengal cricket. Saha operated as player cum mentor of the Tripura senior side for two years.The CAB has been trying to bring the former Test wicketkeeper back to Bengal for a long time. It now seems that Saha has agreed to return after meeting former India skipper Sourav Ganguly at his residence on Monday afternoon. Although neither Saha nor the CAB have made any formal announcement, it was learnt that talks with Ganguly have helped break the ice.Just days back, left-handed batter Sudip Chatterjee also decided to return to Bengal after two seasons with Tripura. The former Bengal vice-captain will be playing in the upcoming Bengal Pro T20 league also.Saha was also finding it difficult to stay away from family for a longer period of time. The 39-year-old player has just returned home after playing for Gujarat Titans in the IPL this season.The Siliguri boy reportedly has already asked for No Objection Certificate (NOC) from the Tripura Cricket Association.However, with youngster Abhishek Porel establishing himself as Bengal’s rising wicketkeeper batter, it remains to be seen how Saha will be fitted in the side. With the IPL mega auction also on the horizon, it could thus turn out to be an important season for Saha.
Article Summary: Wicketkeeper-batter had formally parted ways with Cricket Association of Bengal ( CAB ) on July 2, 2022. Saha operated as player cum mentor of the Tripura senior side for two years. CAB has been trying to bring the former Test wicketkeeper back to Bengal for a long time.

Article Title: England's Will Jacks thankful for Virat Kohli influence ahead of T20 World Cup
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Will Jacks is keen to apply the on-field " coaching " he received from Virat Kohli during the IPL to help England retain their T20 World Cup title next month. Jacks heads into the third game of England's warm-up series against Pakistan on the back of a pivotal 37-run contribution that propelled England to a 23-run victory at Edgbaston.The Surrey all-rounder demonstrated his power-hitting prowess, recently smashing an unbeaten century off just 41 balls, including 28 runs from one Rashid Khan over, while playing for Royal Challengers Bangalore against Gujarat Titans. Kohli, who was batting at the other end, provided valuable insights."The big thing with the IPL is that every game is such an occasion, the crowd, the atmosphere," Jacks shared with reporters. "Every game you feel like you've got to step up, and that's similar to international cricket."Reflecting on his experience with Kohli, Jacks said, "He's a very good role model. The way he approaches all the training and every aspect of the game off the field, his intensity, everything he does is 100 percent attention. He's done it for such a long time, and I can appreciate that as a young guy who often doesn't want to do the hard yards, but you see him doing it and want to copy that."Jacks emphasized the learning experience, "When we were batting together, he was coaching me through there. I learned some valuable things about chasing in that innings and pacing the game, which was really helpful. I was really proud of the way I stayed in the partnership and didn't throw it away."With limited international experience—two Tests, seven ODIs, and 12 T20s—Jacks is eager for the upcoming global tournament. "Playing in a World Cup is something I've dreamed of since I was a little kid. I'm really excited to do it. It's getting closer now, and we're building in the right direction."Regarding his T20 record of 218 runs at an average of 18.16, Jacks acknowledged it as a "mixed bag." He has been alternating between opening the innings and batting at number three. "I've probably opened half my games and batted number three in the other half," he noted. "It's no lie that I'm new to batting at three, I'm learning on the job."Jacks added, "I've been getting starts every game, and it's about how do I change those into match-winning scores. That's more of a mindset thing. It doesn't matter what I'm averaging: if the team's winning, then it's good."
Article Summary: Will Jacks is keen to apply the coaching he received from Virat Kohli during the IPL to help England retain their T20 World Cup title next month. Jacks heads into the third game of England's warm-up series against Pakistan on the back of a pivotal 37-run contribution that propelled England to a 23-run victory.

Article Title: Shreyas Iyer thanks KKR cheerleaders after IPL title triumph; gesture wins hearts - WATCH

NEW DELHI: Kolkata Knight Riders delivered a masterclass in bowling, restricting Sunrisers Hyderabad to a mere 113 runs to pave the way for an emphatic eight-wicket triumph on Sunday, securing their third Indian Premier League title.Australian speedster Mitchell Starc led the charge, unsettling Sunrisers Hyderabad's top-order with figures of 2-14, while every KKR bowler contributed to the onslaught, culminating in the most aggressive batting team of the season being dismissed for the lowest-ever total in IPL finals history.In reply, Venkatesh Iyer showcased his firepower with a blistering unbeaten 52 off just 26 balls, guiding KKR to victory at 114-2 in only 10.3 overs, with Rahmanullah Gurbaz contributing 39 runs from 32 balls.Following the win, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer expressed gratitude to the fans for their unwavering support.Iyer also won hearts by personally acknowledging the cheerleaders and thanking them.KKR, previously crowned champions in 2012 and 2014, dominated the IPL season by finishing atop the league stage with nine wins from 14 matches.After the title win, captain Shreyas Iyer hailed his team's performance, describing them as "invincibles" throughout the season."Absolutely comprehensive (the win). We played like invincibles throughout the season. There's so much to cherish right now. This is what we demanded from the team and every individual," Shreyas said during the post-match presentation."They stood up to the right occasion and the feeling is hard to express. It is pleasing, the performance has been flawless throughout. I am running out of words right now," he added.

NEW DELHI: A stellar performance from Kolkata Knight Riders, featuring impressive spells by Mitchell Starc and Andre Russell alongside a commanding half-century by Venkatesh Iyer, propelled the Purple and Gold brigade to their third Indian Premier League (IPL) title on Sunday.KKR convincingly defeated the Sunrisers Hyderabad by eight wickets in a one-sided summit clash at Chennai's MA Chidambaram Stadium.Opting to field first, Kolkata Knight Riders capitalised on their bowlers' superb display to dismiss Sunrisers for a meager 113 runs.KKR chased down the target in just 10.3 overs.The jubilant scenes unfolded as KKR celebrated their third title triumph.Following their victory, Russell was spotted grooving with Bollywood actress Ananya Panday to the tunes of the Bollywood track 'Lutt Putt Gaya' from the Shah Rukh Khan-starrer movie 'Dunki'.Finishing atop the group stage of the 10-team league, KKR continued their dominance by defeating SRH in the first qualifier on Tuesday and carrying that momentum into the final, which concluded in a mere 29 overs.In a symbolic gesture of appreciation, KKR players lifted their mentor Gautam Gambhir on their shoulders to celebrate the victory.This marked Gambhir's inaugural stint as a mentor with KKR, having previously led the team to titles in 2012 and 2014 as captain.

Article Title: Cristiano Ronaldo sets new Saudi Pro League season goal-scoring record
Article Text:
(Inputs from AP)

NEW DELHI: Cristiano Ronaldo concluded the Saudi Pro League season by establishing a new goal-scoring record on Monday. In Riyadh, Ronaldo found the back of the net twice as Al-Nassr secured a 4-2 victory over Al-Ittihad, bringing his league goal tally to 35, surpassing the previous record of 34 set by Abderrazak Hamdallah in 2019.In the closing moments of the first half, Ronaldo, who had already seen two goals disallowed for offside, brought down a long pass from Mohammed Al-Fatil with his chest and scored with a low shot from the left side of the area. With 21 minutes left to play, the five-time Ballon d'Or winner celebrated enthusiastically after heading in a corner from Marcelo Brozovic . Five minutes later, he was substituted off the field to a standing ovation from the home supporters.Ronaldo's season was filled with notable moments, including four hat tricks and one red card. He also faced a suspension in February for making an obscene gesture towards Al-Shabab fans who had been chanting the name of his long-time soccer rival, Lionel Messi.Al-Nassr secured a second-place finish in the league, trailing local rival Al-Hilal by 14 points. Al-Hilal clinched the championship more than two weeks ago and completed the 34-round league undefeated on Monday. Even without the services of Neymar, who joined the club in August from Paris Saint-Germain but suffered a season-ending ACL injury in October, Al-Hilal proved to be a formidable force.Aleksandar Mitrovic , signed from London club Fulham last summer, stepped up and concluded the season with a goal in the final seconds, sealing a 2-1 win over Al-Wehda. The Serbian striker finished with 27 league goals, second only to Ronaldo. Al-Hilal's title-winning campaign included a 34-game winning streak across all competitions, setting a new world record for a top-tier team."This season has been truly exceptional for the team, arguably our best ever," coach Jorge Jesus said. "The credit goes to the immense talent within the squad and the incredible sense of unity that transcends both on and off-field interactions."Al-Ittihad's loss to Al-Nassr capped off a disappointing season for the defending champion. Karim Benzema, acquired from Real Madrid, struggled with injuries, and despite the presence of N'Golo Kante and Fabinho in midfield, signed from Chelsea and Liverpool respectively, the Jeddah-based team could only manage a fifth-place finish. Poor results led to the dismissal of coach Nuno Santo in November, who returned to the English Premier League a month later to take charge of Nottingham Forest.Al-Ahli, the fourth of the 'Big Four' clubs acquired by Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund last June, secured a third-place finish, 17 points behind Al-Nassr. Al-Ahli defeated Al-Fayha 1-0, courtesy of a late goal from former Liverpool forward Roberto Firmino, his ninth of the season.Amid various storylines, Ronaldo dominated the headlines, and the 39-year-old still has one more opportunity to end the season with a trophy when Al-Nassr faces Al-Hilal in the King's Cup final on Friday.
Article Summary: Cristiano Ronaldo scores twice as Al-Nassr beats Al-Ittihad 4-2 in Saudi Pro League. Ronaldo surpasses the previous record of 34 set by Abderrazak Hamdallah in 2019. Al-Hilal completed the 34-round league undefeated, setting a new world record.

Article Title: FC Cologne and Timo Schultz mutually agree to end contract after relegation
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: Following their relegation to the second division, German club FC Cologne and manager Timo Schultz have amicably parted ways. Schultz, who took the reins in January with Cologne struggling in the relegation zone, was unable to steer the club clear of the drop.In a joint decision after an extensive review of the season, FC Cologne announced, "After comprehensive joint analysis of the past season, FC Cologne and head coach Timo Schultz have mutually agreed not to extend the employment contract."This marks a disappointing turn for Cologne, who, despite being three-time champions in the top flight, will now compete in the second division after five seasons in the Bundesliga . Their last major trophy win dates back to 1983 when they clinched the German Cup for the fourth time. In recent years, the club has experienced fluctuations between the top two divisions.Cologne's relegation coincided with Darmstadt's, while St Pauli earned promotion alongside newcomers Holstein Kiel . Additionally, in the Bundesliga relegation playoff second leg, bitter rivals Fortuna Duesseldorf of the second division hosted first division Bochum , with Fortuna leading 3-0 from the first leg.
Article Summary: FC Cologne and manager Timo Schultz have amicably parted ways. Schultz took the reins in January with Cologne struggling in the relegation zone. Cologne's relegation coincided with Darmstadt's, while St Pauli earned promotion alongside newcomers Holstein Kiel.

NEW DELHI: Spain coach Luis de la Fuente has announced a provisional 29-man squad for Euro 2024, featuring Barcelona's teenage talents Lamine Yamal and Pau Cubarsi . Yamal, 16, and Cubarsi, 17, have made significant impressions this season. Alongside them, Barcelona midfielder Fermin Lopez and Real Betis' Ayoze Perez have received their first international call-ups.De la Fuente will trim the squad to 26 players by June 7, ahead of the tournament's start in Germany on June 14. Notably absent from the squad are Marco Asensio, Gerard Moreno, and Pablo Sarabia, who have been regulars in recent years.The inclusion of three extra players is a precautionary measure, considering the possibility of injuries, particularly with Real Madrid involved in the Champions League final against Borussia Dortmund on June 1. De la Fuente emphasized the importance of having versatile players to mitigate any potential issues."It's a guarantee against any setback that could happen in the Champions League final, or in training, that would generate a problem," De la Fuente explained. "They all have the same chance (of going), we will minimise risks, we have very versatile players."Spain, winners of the European Championship in 1964, 2008, and 2012, reached the semi-finals in the last edition.They face a challenging Group B , labelled the 'group of death,' with matches against Italy, Croatia, and Albania. Prior to the tournament, Spain will play friendlies against Andorra on June 5 and Northern Ireland on June 8.Unai Simon (Athletic Bilbao), Alex Remiro (Real Sociedad), David Raya (Arsenal/ENG)Dani Carvajal (Real Madrid), Jesus Navas (Sevilla), Pau Cubarsi (Barcelona), Robin Le Normand (Real Sociedad), Dani Vivian (Athletic Bilbao), Nacho Fernandez (Real Madrid), Aymeric Laporte (Al Nassr/KSA), Alex Grimaldo (Bayer Leverkusen/GER), Marc Cucurella (Chelsea/ENG)Rodri Hernandez (Manchester City/ENG), Martin Zubimendi, Mikel Merino (Real Sociedad), Marcos Llorente (Atletico Madrid), Fabian Ruiz (Paris Saint-Germain/FRA), Pedri, Fermin Lopez (both Barcelona), Alex Baena (Villarreal), Aleix Garcia (Girona)Alvaro Morata (Atletico Madrid), Joselu (Real Madrid), Nico Williams (Athletic Bilbao), Dani Olmo (RB Leipzig/GER), Lamine Yamal, Ferran Torres (both Barcelona), Mikel Oyarzabal (Real Sociedad), Ayoze Perez (Real Betis)

Article Title: 'I don't think the work has been appreciated enough': Xavi's stay at Barcelona ends on a bittersweet note
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Barcelona concluded their season with a 2-1 win against Sevilla in LaLiga on Sunday, leaving departing coach Xavi Hernandez with mixed emotions following a campaign without any trophies and a second-place finish, 10 points behind champions Real Madrid .In Xavi's final match, after being dismissed on Friday, Barcelona faced the disappointment of a season that saw them lose the Spanish Super Cup final to Real Madrid and suffer elimination from the Champions League by Paris St Germain in the quarter-finals."I don't think the work has been appreciated enough," said Xavi. "A double last year (LaLiga and Super Cup) and this year we haven't been up to the task because of details."I leave with some mixed feelings because the work is positive even though we didn't win the titles this season. I think we were on the right track and I still think so."Barcelona started the match aggressively and took the lead in the 15th minute when Robert Lewandowski scored his 19th league goal of the season from close range, capitalizing on a cross from Joao Cancelo .Sevilla equalized through Youssef En-Nesyri 's goal in the 31st minute and threatened again but couldn't beat Marc-Andre ter Stegen before Fermin Lopez secured the winning goal for Barcelona on the hour mark.Ter Stegen reflected on the future, saying, "Today is not the best time to talk about the future but we have a lot of good players. We have to work a lot more on an individual level to be able to compete with anyone next year. Xavi has always given us a lot. He worked every day so that we could succeed. On a personal level he's been a friend for many years and it's never easy to let him go."
Article Summary: Barcelona end their season with a 2-1 win against Sevilla in LaLiga on Sunday. Coach Xavi Hernandez leaves with mixed emotions following a campaign without any trophies. Barcelona finished second in the league, 10 points behind champions Real Madrid.

Article Title: Southampton return to Premier League as Armstrong sinks Leeds in play-off final
Article Text:
(With AFP inputs)

NEW DELHI: Southampton secured promotion back to the Premier League after a one-year absence, with Adam Armstrong 's decisive goal leading to a 1-0 victory against Leeds in the Championship play-off final on Sunday.Armstrong's first-half strike at Wembley erased the disappointment of last year's relegation from the top flight, ensuring Southampton's immediate return.Winning football's most lucrative match will bring Southampton an estimated £140 million ($178 million) boost, thanks to the increased matchday, broadcast, and commercial revenues associated with the Premier League.According to financial experts Deloitte, Southampton could ultimately earn up to £305 million if they manage to avoid relegation next season.While the cash prize is a huge bonus, it is the prestige of competing with Manchester City and Arsenal, rather than second-tier minnows like Plymouth and Oxford, that fuelled Southampton's hunger to regain their Premier League status after a year in purgatory.Southampton, whose only major honour is the 1976 FA Cup, had spent 11 years in the Premier League prior to their relegation.They will hope this success, celebrated by over 35,000 of their fans at Wembley, is the prelude to another lengthy spell among the elite.In their first ever play-off final, Southampton made it three wins over Leeds this term despite finishing three points behind the Elland Road club in the regular season.Saints boss Russell Martin has become widely admired for his purist passing principles and this was the 38-year-old's crowning glory.Martin was managing in League One with Milton Keynes Dons just three years ago, but he has transformed Southampton in his first season in charge, to such an extent that they boasted more possession than any team in Europe's top five leagues this season.Securing promotion at Leeds boss Daniel Farke's expense was a sweet moment for Martin after his Norwich contract was terminated by the German during their time together at Carrow Road in 2018.Defeat was a bitter blow for Farke and Leeds, who were relegated alongside Southampton last season.American socialite Paris Hilton and movie star Will Ferrell -- a minority shareholder in the club -- had made good luck videos for Farke's side, but there was no Hollywood ending for Leeds.On the 35th anniversary of the death of their legendary manager Don Revie, Leeds were well below their best in the club's fourth play-off final loss.After losing their grip on an automatic promotion place that went instead to Ipswich, the three-time English champions remain without a win at Wembley since 1992.With Rain Man actor Dustin Hoffman watching from the stands, it was fitting that the heavens opened over Wembley as a torrential downpour hit just before kick-off.Leeds made a fast start but Southampton weathered the storm and as the sun appeared through the clouds, they gradually took control.Will Smallbone threatened to put Southampton ahead with a 30-yard free-kick that was clawed away by Illan Meslier.It was a warning Leeds failed to heed as Southampton snatched the lead with a clinical raid in the 24th minute.Armstrong had scored twice in the play-off semi-final win over West Brom and the striker showcased his predatory instincts again with his 24th goal this season.Cleverly eluding the Leeds offside trap with a well-timed run, Armstrong met Smallbone's pass with a superb strike into the far corner from 12 yards.Leeds were rocked and Armstrong nearly struck again from another instinctive shot from Smallbone's quick free-kick, but this time Meslier was able to parry his close-range effort.Early in the second half, Leeds defender Joe Rodon embarked on a rampaging run that looked certain to end in a goal until Taylor Harwood-Bellis threw himself into a last-ditch block.Leeds pushed hard for an equaliser, but Daniel James' blast cannoned back off the bar before the winger was denied by Alex McCarthy's stoppage-time save as Southampton celebrated their return to the promised land.
Article Summary: Southampton beat Leeds 1-0 in the Championship play-off final at Wembley. Adam Armstrong scored the only goal of the game in the first half. Southampton will return to the Premier League after a one-year absence. Leeds were relegated from the top flight last season.

Article Title: Toni Kroos bids emotional farewell as Real Madrid play out an uneventful 0-0 draw against Real Betis
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: German midfielder Toni Kroos played his final La Liga match for Real Madrid at the Santiago Bernabeu on Saturday, which ended in a goalless draw against Real Betis .The 34-year-old, who plans to retire after Euro 2024 , expressed his gratitude to the club, his teammates, and the fans, stating, "It's not easy, I can only say thanks to Madrid, the club, my team-mates, to the stadium, I've always felt at home here in these 10 years, I can't ask for more, they've been 10 unforgettable years."Real Madrid, the Spanish champions, have one remaining match this season - the Champions League final against Borussia Dortmund at Wembley on June 1.Despite fielding a strong lineup, likely to be the starting eleven for the final, the team did not exert themselves in the uneventful 0-0 draw against Betis, as there was nothing at stake except the risk of potential injuries. The club finished the season with only one league defeat and remained unbeaten at the Bernabeu.In other matches, Atletico Madrid secured a 2-0 victory at Real Sociedad to finish fourth, while Athletic Bilbao defeated Rayo Vallecano 1-0. Almeria, who spent most of the season without a single win, earned their third victory in a 6-1 thrashing of Cadiz, moving off the bottom of the table and leaving Granada in 20th place.Villarreal's Alexander Sorloth suffered an injury during his team's 1-1 draw against Osasuna, which allowed Girona striker Artem Dovbyk to claim the Golden Boot with 24 goals, one ahead of the Norwegian, after scoring a hat-trick on Friday.
Article Summary: Toni Kroos played his final La Liga match for Real Madrid against Real Betis. The 34-year-old midfielder plans to retire after Euro 2024. Real Madrid finished the season with only one league defeat and remained unbeaten at the Bernabeu. Atletico Madrid secured a 2-0 victory at Real Sociedad to finish fourth.

Article Title: Barcelona beat Lyon 2-0 to win second straight Women's Champions League
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Barcelona secured a 2-0 victory against Olympique Lyonnais in the Women's Champions League final on Saturday, marking their second consecutive triumph in the tournament. The match, held at San Mames stadium in Bilbao, was attended by a significant number of Barcelona supporters.The first half ended goalless, with both teams having close chances. Lucy Bronze nearly scored an own goal for Barcelona in the 14th minute, while Vanessa Gilles cleared a shot off the line for Lyon. Caroline Graham Hansen also had an opportunity to score for Barcelona.In the second half, Barcelona took control of the game, and Aitana Bonmati , the reigning Ballon d'Or and FIFA Best Women's Player, broke the deadlock in the 63rd minute with a deflected shot. Despite the introduction of record goalscorer Ada Hegerberg, Lyon was unable to equalize.Alexia Putellas , who had been dealing with a persistent knee issue, came off the bench to score in stoppage time, sealing Barcelona's victory."We knew we needed to be a club that made history, it's not easy - it's hard to do it once, but to do it back to back? Lyon showed how difficult that is," said Barcelona defender Lucy Bronze. "This team has finally done that, I think we go down in history as one of the best teams in Europe."Lyon, known for their dominance in the competition, expressed disappointment in their performance. "I'm very emotional, no-one likes to lose a final ... I'm still very proud of my team, We gave it our all, we have some regrets of course, but hopefully next year we're back again," said Lyon midfielder Danielle van de Donk.
Article Summary: Barcelona secured a 2-0 victory against Olympique Lyonnais in the Women's Champions League final on Saturday. It was Barcelona's second consecutive triumph in the tournament. The match, held at San Mames stadium in Bilbao, was attended by a significant number of Barcelona supporters.

Article Title: Ten-man Bayer Leverkusen clinch German Cup for first-ever domestic double
Article Text:
(Inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Bundesliga champions Bayer Leverkusen secured a hard-fought 1-0 victory against second division side Kaiserslautern on Saturday, clinching the German Cup and achieving their first-ever domestic double.This triumph comes just days after their 3-0 defeat to Atalanta in the Europa League final , which ended their remarkable 51-game unbeaten run, a European record.The victory in Berlin's Olympic stadium, the venue for the upcoming Euro 2024 final, marks Leverkusen's second German Cup win, with their first dating back to 1993.Granit Xhaka 's stunning 20-metre strike in the 16th minute proved to be the decisive goal. Despite being reduced to 10 men after Odilon Kossounou's second booking just before halftime, Leverkusen maintained control of the match.Kaiserslautern struggled to create chances in the second half, allowing Leverkusen to comfortably hold on to their lead and cap off a remarkable season with a second trophy.Club CEO Fernando Carro praised the team's performance, stating, "It was a deserved victory. We could have added another goal but overall a fully deserved win. We lifted the Cup after we failed to do so Wednesday. Compliments to the team to win this double."Leverkusen, once mocked as 'Neverkusen' for their inability to win a major title since their 1993 Cup victory, have silenced their critics by not only winning the German Cup but also securing the Bundesliga title without a single defeat – a feat never before achieved by a German team.
Article Summary: Bayer Leverkusen beat Kaiserslautern 1-0 in the German Cup final. Granit Xhaka scored the only goal of the game in the 16th minute. This is the first-ever domestic double for the Bundesliga champions. This triumph comes just days after their Europa League final defeat.

Article Title: French Open: 'I wouldn't call them holes, they are...' — Novak Djokovic aims to overcome setbacks in French Open 2024
Article Text:
(Inputs from AFP)

NEW DELHI: World number one Novak Djokovic is set to begin his French Open title defence on Tuesday, despite a lacklustre season. The 37-year-old is aiming for his fourth Roland Garros title and a record-extending 25th major. But he has yet to win a title or reach a final in 2024, with his best performances being semi-final appearances at the Australian Open and Monte Carlo Masters.Djokovic has faced some setbacks this season, including being accidentally hit on the head by a metal water bottle in Rome, which caused nausea and dizziness, and suffering from a stomach problem in Geneva last week, where he was knocked out by Tomas Machac of the Czech Republic."I wouldn't call them holes, they are rather bumps on the road," said Djokovic.However, he remains confident in his ability to perform in a Grand Slam environment, stating, "I have always looked ahead, what is the next challenge, and what it takes for me to be better than I was last week. I know exactly what I need to do in a Grand Slam environment. I've experienced that 24 times in my career."On Tuesday, Djokovic will face French wildcard Pierre-Hugues Herbert , whom he defeated in their only previous meeting at the Paris Masters in 2013. Herbert, currently ranked 142nd in the world, made the third round in 2018 but hasn't won a match on the main tour this year.In the women's draw, world number two Aryna Sabalenka begins her quest to reach her first Roland Garros final. The two-time Australian Open champion has reached at least the semi-finals in each of the past six Grand Slam events and is the only woman to have beaten world number oneIga Swiatek in a final on clay since 2019.Sabalenka, who had never reached the second week at Roland Garros until last year, will face Russia's Erika Andreeva in her opening match.Other notable matches on Tuesday include fourth seed Elena Rybakina , whose best run at Roland Garros was a quarter-final spot in 2021, taking on Belgium's Greet Minnen.In the men's singles, Argentine qualifier Roman Andres Burruchaga, the son of Jorge Burruchaga, who scored the winning goal for Argentina in the 1986 World Cup final, will make his Grand Slam debut against Germany's Jan-Lennard Struff.
Article Summary: World number one Novak Djokovic begins his French Open title defence on Tuesday. The 37-year-old is aiming for his fourth Roland Garros title and a record- extending 25th major. He will face French wildcard Pierre-Hugues Herbert, whom he defeated in their only previous meeting at the Paris Masters in 2013.

Article Title: Rafael Nadal says 'difficult' and 'not smart' to play Wimbledon

Article Title: French Open: Karen Khachanov knocks out Sumit Nagal in opening round
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Sumit Nagal 's late resistance was insufficient as his French Open debut ended in defeat against the powerful Russian Karen Khachanov , who triumphed in straight sets on Monday.The top Indian singles player, ranked 95th, struggled to counter the power and precision of his higher-ranked opponent, losing 2-6, 0-6, 6-7(5) in the opening round.Nagal, who had stunned world number 31 Alexander Bublik at the Australian Open, was unable to replicate his heroic performance on the red clay.Pre-match rain had slowed the court, making it more conducive to longer rallies. Nagal started strongly, but Khachanov secured the first break of the match in the third game, setting the tone for the rest of the encounter.Nagal, though, did well to come back from 0-40 to save three breakpoints. However, looking for a wide forehand, he made an unforced error to hand his rival the first break of the match.Rain interrupted the match and resumed after a 21 minute-break. The Russian came out firing on all cylinders as Nagal found it difficult to match the power of Khachanov.It was effortless hitting from the Russian, which Nagal failed to counter.Nagal had little time to react to the shots as the Russian made him run on both flanks. It was difficult to control or create points.He was up 30-0 in game seven but Khachanov reeled off four points in a row to get his second break of the opening set, which he served out in the next game with an inside-out forehand winner, albeit after saving a break chance.He needed solid start to the second set but Nagal dropped his serve in the very first game to go on backfoot. He had two break chances to level the set but Khachanov saved both and broke his rival again for a comfortable 3-0 cushion.Soon it became 5-0 and eventually Khachanov bageled Nagal.From thereon, it was a herculean task for the Indian to make a comeback. Article Summary: Sumit Nagal loses in straight sets to Karen Khachanov in French Open first round. Nagal had stunned world number 31 Alexander Bublik at the Australian Open. The top Indian singles player, ranked 95th, struggled to counter the power and precision of his higher-ranked opponent.

Article Title: Clinical Iga Swiatek crushes qualifier Leolia Jeanjean to start French Open defence
Article Text:
(With inputs from Reuters)

NEW DELHI: Top-ranked Iga Swiatek on Monday made a strong start to her French Open title defense, securing a comfortable 6-1 6-2 victory over qualifier Leolia Jeanjean in the opening round.Swiatek, 22, who has been a dominant force on clay courts, is aiming to capture her fourth French Open title.The Polish star has already triumphed in Paris three times in the past four years and coming into the tournament, Swiatek had built impressive momentum, riding a 12-match winning streak on clay that included titles in Madrid and Rome.She did not need much time to show she was determined to stretch that winning run, breaking her opponent in the first game.A superb forehand down the line put Swiatek 4-1 up before running away with the first set in half an hour.The Frenchwoman, ranked outside the top 100, tried to draw a line under the first set, breaking the Pole at the start of the second outing but was broken straight back.Swiatek held serve before earning another break to go 5-2 up, having hit 24 winners at that stage compared to her opponents' two. She ended the contest on her first match point and with winner number 26.
